parameters.name: managedAppRevisionName
parameters.description: The name of the managed app revision resource.

get.description: List the operations for the provider

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: A link to the status monitor

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The content of the action request

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

userAssignedIdentityId.description: The resource id of the user assigned identity

clientId.description: The client id of the user assigned identity

principalId.description: The principal id of the user assigned identity

applicationType.description: Determines the application type. This influences the base set of kubernetes manifests that will be used

additionalK8sResources.description:
Additional k8s resources (in yaml format) to deploy along with the app
This can include things like ConfigMaps, Secrets, PersistentVolumeClaims, etc.
Do we split this out into separate fields? Easier to maintain as raw yaml, but harder to validate

namespacedPermissions.description: Represents the permissions for k8s resources that this app has, restricted to the same namespace the app is deployed in. This will create kubernetes Roles and RoleBindings for the app when it is deployed into a managed namespace

clusterWidePermissions.description: Represents the permissions for k8s resources that this app has, cluster wide. Do not set this field if the app is not supposed to read resources outside of the namespace it is deployed in. This will create kubernetes ClusterRoles and ClusterRoleBindings for the app when it is deployed into a managed namespace

healthChecks.description: An array of prometheus expressions to evaluate to determine if the app is healthy. Multiple expressions in this list are logically AND-ed together, so all must return true in order for the app to be considered healthy

scaling.description: Scaling type for the app. Default is manual scaling

identity.description: User assigned identity for the app deployment to use

template.description: Deployment Template for the app. Specify any configuration that will be needed or used for every deployment

generatedServiceAccountName.description: The name of the generated service account. This is generated from the app deployment name, and namespace name

generatedKubernetesServiceName.description: The name of the generated kubernetes service. This is generated from the app deployment name and namespace name

provisioningState.description: The status of the last operation.

gitHubRunner.description: Configuration for GitHub Runner trigger. Only required when type is 'github-runner'.

azureAppInsights.description: Configuration for Azure App Insights trigger. Only required when type is 'azure-app-insights'.

azurePipelines.description: Configuration for Azure Pipelines trigger. Only required when type is 'azure-pipelines'.

azureBlob.description: Configuration for Azure Blob trigger. Only required when type is 'azure-blob'.

azureDataExplorer.description: Configuration for Azure Data Explorer trigger. Only required when type is 'azure-data-explorer'.

azureEventHub.description: Configuration for Azure Event Hub trigger. Only required when type is 'azure-eventhub'.

azureLogAnalytics.description: Configuration for Azure Log Analytics trigger. Only required when type is 'azure-log-analytics'.

azureMonitor.description: Configuration for Azure Monitor trigger. Only required when type is 'azure-monitor'.

azureServiceBus.description: Configuration for Azure Service Bus trigger. Only required when type is 'azure-servicebus'.

azureStorageQueue.description: Configuration for Azure Storage Queue trigger. Only required when type is 'azure-storage-queue'.

activeDirectoryClientIdFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Active Directory Client ID

activeDirectoryClientPasswordFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Active Directory Client Password

applicationInsightsIdFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Application Insights ID

tenantIdFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Tenant ID

appInsightsResourceUrl.description: Application Insights resource URL (required when cloud = Private)

activeDirectoryEndpoint.description: Active Directory endpoint (required when cloud = Private)

ignoreNullValues.description: Whether to ignore null values in query results (Default: false)

connectionFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for storage connection string

clientIdFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Client ID

clientSecretFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Client Secret

tenantIdFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Tenant ID

activeDirectoryEndpoint.description: Active Directory endpoint (required when cloud = Private)

connectionFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Event Hub connection string

storageConnectionFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for storage connection string

endpointSuffix.description: Service Bus endpoint suffix (required when cloud = Private)

storageEndpointSuffix.description: Storage endpoint suffix (required when cloud = Private)

storageAccountName.description: Storage account name (required for workload identity auth)

workspaceIdFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Workspace ID

clientIdFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Client ID

tenantIdFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Tenant ID

clientSecretFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Client Secret

logAnalyticsResourceUrl.description: Log Analytics resource URL (required when cloud = Private)

activeDirectoryEndpoint.description: Active Directory endpoint (required when cloud = Private)

unsafeSsl.description: Whether to disable SSL verification (Default: false)

timeout.description: Custom timeout for HTTP client in milliseconds

activeDirectoryClientIdFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Active Directory Client ID

activeDirectoryClientPasswordFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Active Directory Client Password

azureResourceManagerEndpoint.description: Azure Resource Manager endpoint (required when cloud = Private)

activeDirectoryEndpoint.description: Active Directory endpoint (required when cloud = Private)

poolName.description: Name of the pool in Azure DevOps

organizationUrlFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Azure DevOps organization URL

personalAccessTokenFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Personal Access Token

parent.description: Parent template to read demands from

demands.description: Demands string to read from ScaledObject

requireAllDemands.description: Whether job demands must exactly match trigger capabilities

requireAllDemandsAndIgnoreOthers.description: Whether to require specified demands and ignore extras

jobsToFetch.description: Number of jobs to fetch in API call (Default: 250)

fetchUnfinishedJobsOnly.description: Whether to only fetch unfinished jobs (Default: false)

caseInsensitiveDemandsProcessing.description: Enable case-insensitive comparison of demands (Default: false)

queueName.description: Queue name (required if not using topic)

serviceBusNamespace.description: Service Bus namespace (required when using workload identity)

connectionFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for Service Bus connection string

endpointSuffix.description: Service Bus endpoint suffix (required when cloud = Private)

connectionFromEnv.description: Environment variable name for storage connection string

ConfigMapKeyToPath.description: Maps a string key to a path within a volume.

path.description: The relative path of the file to map the key to.

mode.description: Optional: mode bits used to set permissions on this file.

ConfigMapVolume.description: Adapts a ConfigMap into a volume.

defaultMode.description: Optional: mode bits used to set permissions on created files by default.

items.description: If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced ConfigMap will be projected into the volume as a file.

optional.description: Specify whether the ConfigMap or its keys must be defined.

command.description: Command to run in the container

probes.description: An array of probes for the container

resources.description: Container Resource Requirements. If not specified, defaults will be applied

ContainerPort.description: Represents an exposed port on a container

protocol.description: Protocol for the port. Defaults to TCP

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before health checks are initiated

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the health check

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the health check times out

successThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the health check to be considered successful after having failed

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the health check to be considered failed after having succeeded

image.description: Container image of App. This represents a fully qualified container image name, including the registry and tag. i.e. myregistry.azurecr.io/myapp:v1

replicas.description: Number of replicas. Only needed if the ScalingType is Manual. Defaults to 3

command.description: Command to run in the container

primaryPort.description: The primary port your application listens on, where it receives traffic. Required if ingress configuration is set

containerProbes.description: An array of container probes for the app. If not specified, the default is an http request to /healthz

additionalPorts.description: Additional ports your application listens on

EmptyDirVolume.description: EmptyDir represents a temporary directory that shares a pod's lifetime.

medium.description: What type of storage medium should back this directory.

sizeLimit.description: Total amount of local storage required for this EmptyDir volume.

secretRef.description: Reference to a secret for the environment variable

githubApiUrl.description: The URL of the GitHub API (Default: https://api.github.com)

owner.description: The owner of the GitHub repository or organization

runnerScope.description: The scope of the runner: org (organization), ent (enterprise), or repo (repository)

repos.description: List of repositories to scale, separated by comma

labels.description: List of runner labels to scale on, separated by comma

noDefaultLabels.description: Do not scale on default runner labels (self-hosted, linux, x64) (Default: false)

matchUnlabeledJobsWithUnlabeledRunners.description: When enabled, unlabeled jobs will not match unlabeled runners (Default: false)

enableEtags.description: Enable etag headers for conditional requests to GitHub API (Default: false)

targetWorkflowQueueLength.description: Target number of queued jobs to scale on (Default: 1)

applicationId.description: Application ID from the GitHub App

installationId.description: Installation ID from the GitHub App once installed into org or repo

port.description: Port to fetch metrics. Default is 8080

metricsPath.description: Metrics path for Prometheus to scrape. Default is /metrics

query.description: Prometheus expression to evaluate. Expression must return no results if the app is healthy

durationSeconds.description: Duration in seconds for which the query must be true to consider the app healthy

frequencySeconds.description: The frequency in seconds at which the query is evaluated

state.description: The evaluated state of this health check
Ingress state, enabled or disabled. Intended to answer the question 'does my app accept public traffic?'. Use TrafficRules to configure traffic routing

ingressType.description: Ingress type needed. I.e. http, grpc,

values.name: Public
values.description: Public visibility, accessible from the internet

values.name: Private
values.description: Private visibility, only accessible within the cluster

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

eTag.description: If eTag is provided in the response body, it may also be provided as a header per the normal etag convention.  Entity tags are used for comparing two or more entities from the same requested resource. HTTP/1.1 uses entity tags in the etag (section 14.19), If-Match (section 14.24), If-None-Match (section 14.26), and If-Range (section 14.27) header fields.

ManagedAppRevision.description: Concrete extension resource types can be created by aliasing this type using a specific property type.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

eTag.description: If eTag is provided in the response body, it may also be provided as a header per the normal etag convention.  Entity tags are used for comparing two or more entities from the same requested resource. HTTP/1.1 uses entity tags in the etag (section 14.19), If-Match (section 14.24), If-None-Match (section 14.26), and If-Range (section 14.27) header fields.

ManagedAppRevisionListResult.description: The response of a ManagedAppRevision list operation.

value.description: The ManagedAppRevision items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

ManagedAppRollbackPostParameters.description: Parameters for rolling back a managed app to a previous revision

managedAppRevisionName.description: The name of the managed app revision to rollback to

ManagedCluster.description: Represents a managed cluster. Just a placeholder until rest of aks is converted to typespec

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

ManagedClusterProperties.description: Managed Cluster properties. Just a placeholder

provisioningState.description: The status of the last operation.

ManagedNamespace.description: Managed Namespace resource. Just a placeholder for now

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

ManagedNamespaceProperties.description: Managed Namespace properties. Just a placeholder

provisioningState.description: The status of the last operation.

Permissions.description: Role definition for k8s resources that the app needs to access

verbs.description: Verbs that are allowed for these groups/resources. i.e. "GET", "CREATE", etc

PersistentVolumeClaimVolume.description: PersistentVolumeClaimVolume references a user's PVC in the same namespace.

claimName.description: ClaimName is the name of a PersistentVolumeClaim in the same namespace as the pod using this volume.

readOnly.description: Will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.

values.name: Accepted
values.description: The resource create request has been accepted

type.description: Scaling type for the app. Default is manual scaling

minReplicas.description: Minimum number of replicas for the app when using autoscaling

maxReplicas.description: Maximum number of replicas for the app when using autoscaling

autoscalingTriggers.description: List of autoscaling triggers for the app

SecretKeyToPath.description: Maps a string key to a path within a volume.

path.description: The relative path of the file to map the key to.

mode.description: Optional: mode bits used to set permissions on this file.

SecretVolume.description: Adapts a Secret into a volume.

defaultMode.description: Optional: mode bits used to set permissions on created files by default.

items.description: If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced Secret will be projected into the volume as a file.

optional.description: Specify whether the Secret or its keys must be defined.

StorageMedium.description: Storage medium type for EmptyDir volume.

values.name: Default
values.description: Use default storage medium for the node

UserAssignedIdentity.description: A type definition that refers the id to an Azure Resource Manager resource.

azureManagedPrometheusWorkspaceId.description: A type definition that refers the id to an Azure Resource Manager resource.

logAnalyticsWorkspaceId.description: A type definition that refers the id to an Azure Resource Manager resource.

Azure.ResourceManager.ResourceUriParamet.name: resourceUri
Azure.ResourceManager.ResourceUriParamet.description: The fully qualified Azure Resource manager identifier of the resource.
